tool.name: MACS2 randsample
tool.description: Randomly sample number or percentage of total reads
tool.command:
macs2 randsample -t '${ infile }' -o '${ outfile }' --seed '${ seed }'
--format '${ infile.extension.upper() }'
@tag_size@
#if $method_options.method_options_selector == 'percentage': --percentage '${ method_options.percentage }' #else: --number '${ method_options.number }' #end if

param.name: percentage
param.label: Percentage of tags you want to keep
param.help: Percentage of tags you want to keep. Input 80.0 for 80%.(--percentage)

param.name: number
param.label: Number of tags you want to keep
param.help: Note that the number of tags in output is approximate as the number specified here (--number)

param.name: seed
param.label: Random seed number
param.help: Set the random seed while down sampling data. Must be a positive integer in order to be effective. (--seed)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This is **randsample** utility from the MACS2_ Package. It randomly samples reads by number or percentage from an input file.
.. _MACS2: https://github.com/taoliu/MACS
@citation@
